test_failures.error_message: ECS service 'microservices-api' has 0 running tasks, expected >= 1
test_failures.traceback:
tests/test_ecs_integration.py:47: in test_ecs_service_running
    assert running_count >= 1, f"ECS service '{service_name}' has {running_count} running tasks, expected >= 1"
E   AssertionError: ECS service 'microservices-api' has 0 running tasks, expected >= 1
test_failures.test_code:
def test_ecs_service_running(ecs_client):
    """Verify ECS service has running tasks"""
    service_name = "microservices-api"
    cluster_name = "microservices-cluster"
    
    response = ecs_client.describe_services(
        cluster=cluster_name,
        services=[service_name]
    )
    
    service = response["services"][0]
    running_count = service["runningCount"]
    
    assert running_count >= 1, f"ECS service '{service_name}' has {running_count} running tasks, expected >= 1"
test_failures.localstack_logs:
2024-12-28 14:35:22 INFO  --- ecs: CreateService for 'microservices-api'
2024-12-28 14:35:22 INFO  --- ecs: Task definition registered: microservices-task:1
2024-12-28 14:35:23 WARN  --- ecs: Container image pull skipped (LocalStack limitation)
2024-12-28 14:35:23 WARN  --- ecs: Task failed to transition to RUNNING state
2024-12-28 14:35:23 ERROR --- ecs: Service 'microservices-api' stuck at 0 running tasks
test_failures.root_cause: LocalStack ECS does not fully simulate container task execution. Tasks are created but never transition to RUNNING state because LocalStack doesn't actually pull and run Docker images for ECS tasks.

test_failures.error_message: Lambda was not triggered within 60 seconds of scheduled time
test_failures.traceback:
tests/test_eventbridge.py:63: in test_scheduled_event_triggers
    await asyncio.wait_for(check_lambda_invoked(), timeout=60)
E   TimeoutError: Lambda was not triggered within 60 seconds
test_failures.test_code:
async def test_scheduled_event_triggers(eventbridge_client, lambda_client):
    """Verify EventBridge schedule triggers Lambda"""
    rule_name = "every-minute-rule"
    
    # Wait for the scheduled event to trigger
    await asyncio.wait_for(check_lambda_invoked(), timeout=60)
    
    # Verify Lambda was invoked
    logs = get_lambda_logs()
    assert len(logs) > 0, "Lambda was not triggered"
test_failures.localstack_logs:
2024-12-28 14:40:01 INFO  --- events: Rule 'every-minute-rule' scheduled
2024-12-28 14:40:01 INFO  --- events: Next trigger: 2024-12-28T14:41:00Z
2024-12-28 14:41:15 WARN  --- events: Scheduler drift detected (+15s)
2024-12-28 14:41:15 INFO  --- events: Triggering target lambda
test_failures.root_cause: LocalStack's EventBridge scheduler has timing inconsistencies. Scheduled events may trigger with delays of 10-30 seconds beyond the expected time, causing timeout-based tests to fail.

test_failures.error_message: An error occurred (TemplateDoesNotExist) when calling SendTemplatedEmail
test_failures.traceback:
tests/test_ses.py:89: in test_ses_send_templated_email
    ses_client.send_templated_email(...)
E   botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (TemplateDoesNotExist)
test_failures.test_code:
def test_ses_send_templated_email(ses_client):
    """Verify SES can send templated emails"""
    response = ses_client.send_templated_email(
        Source='noreply@example.com',
        Destination={'ToAddresses': ['user@example.com']},
        Template='WelcomeEmail',
        TemplateData='{"name": "John"}'
    )
test_failures.localstack_logs:
2024-12-28 14:45:00 INFO  --- ses: SendTemplatedEmail called
2024-12-28 14:45:00 ERROR --- ses: Template 'WelcomeEmail' not found
2024-12-28 14:45:00 WARN  --- ses: Email templates not fully supported
test_failures.root_cause: LocalStack SES supports basic send_email but templated emails (send_templated_email) are not fully implemented. Templates must be created via create_template first, but template rendering is limited.

test_failures.error_message: Error connecting to Redis cluster: Connection refused
test_failures.traceback:
tests/test_elasticache.py:34: in test_redis_session_store
    redis_client.set('session:123', session_data)
E   redis.exceptions.ConnectionError: Error connecting to localhost:6379. Connection refused.
test_failures.test_code:
def test_redis_session_store(redis_client):
    """Verify Redis session storage works"""
    session_data = json.dumps({'user_id': '123', 'role': 'admin'})
    
    # Store session
    redis_client.set('session:123', session_data, ex=3600)
    
    # Retrieve session
    stored = redis_client.get('session:123')
    assert stored == session_data
test_failures.localstack_logs:
2024-12-28 14:50:00 INFO  --- elasticache: CreateCacheCluster 'session-cache'
2024-12-28 14:50:01 WARN  --- elasticache: Redis engine simulation limited
2024-12-28 14:50:01 ERROR --- elasticache: Cluster endpoint not accessible
test_failures.root_cause: LocalStack ElastiCache creates cluster metadata but doesn't run actual Redis instances. The cluster endpoint is created but connections are refused. Use a separate Redis container for testing.

test_failures.test_code:
def test_sms_mfa_challenge(cognito_client):
    """Verify SMS MFA challenge flow"""
    cognito_client.admin_set_user_mfa_preference(
        SMSMfaSettings={'Enabled': True, 'PreferredMfa': True},
        Username='testuser',
        UserPoolId=user_pool_id
    )
test_failures.localstack_logs:
2024-12-28 14:55:00 INFO  --- cognito: SetUserMFAPreference called
2024-12-28 14:55:00 WARN  --- cognito: SMS MFA not implemented
2024-12-28 14:55:00 ERROR --- cognito: MFA type 'SMS_MFA' not supported
test_failures.root_cause: LocalStack Cognito supports basic auth flows but SMS-based MFA is not implemented. TOTP (software token) MFA has partial support.
